info.name: twitter
info.description:
REST API for tweet management in the Twitter microservices system.

This API provides comprehensive tweet management capabilities including:
- Tweet creation with content validation
- Tweet retrieval by ID
- User tweets retrieval with pagination
- Timeline (news feed) retrieval with pagination
- Tweet update with authorization checks
- Tweet deletion (soft delete) with authorization checks
- Tweet likes with business rule validation (no self-likes, uniqueness)
- Tweet unlike (remove like) with business rule validation
- Get users who liked a tweet with pagination
- Tweet retweets with optional comment (no self-retweets, uniqueness)
- Get users who retweeted a tweet with pagination
- Tweet retweet removal with business rule validation
- User existence validation via users-api integration
- Following list retrieval via follower-api integration
- Content length validation (1-280 characters)
- Business rule enforcement

## Authentication
Currently, the API does not require authentication for basic operations.
Future versions will implement JWT-based authentication.

## Rate Limiting
API requests are subject to rate limiting to ensure system stability.
Please refer to response headers for current rate limit information.

## Error Handling
The API uses standard HTTP status codes and follows RFC 7807 Problem Details
for error responses, providing detailed information about validation failures
and business rule violations.

item.name: tweets-api
item.description: API for managing tweets in the Twitter system

request.description: Creates a new tweet with the provided content and user ID. It performs validation on the request data, checks if the user exists via users-api integration, and saves the tweet to the database. The tweet content must be between 1 and 280 characters and cannot be empty or only whitespace.

response.name: content validation error - too long
response.body:
{
  "type": "https://example.com/errors/format-validation",
  "title": "Format Validation Error",
  "status": 400,
  "detail": "Tweet content must be between 1 and 280 characters",
  "fieldName": "content",
  "constraintName": "CONTENT_VALIDATION",
  "timestamp": "2025-01-27T15:30:00Z"
}

response.name: user not exists error
response.body:
{
  "type": "https://example.com/errors/business-rule-validation",
  "title": "Business Rule Validation Error",
  "status": 400,
  "detail": "Business rule 'USER_NOT_EXISTS' violated for context: 00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000",
  "ruleName": "USER_NOT_EXISTS",
  "timestamp": "2025-01-27T15:30:00Z"
}

response.name: constraint violation error - empty content
response.body:
{
  "type": "https://example.com/errors/validation-error",
  "title": "Validation Error",
  "status": 400,
  "detail": "Validation failed: content: Tweet content cannot be empty",
  "timestamp": "2025-01-27T15:30:00Z"
}

request.description: Retrieves a tweet from the database by its unique identifier. Returns 200 OK with tweet data if the tweet exists, or 404 Not Found if the tweet does not exist. The tweetId must be a valid UUID format.

response.name: tweet not found
response.body:
{
  "type": "https://example.com/errors/not-found",
  "title": "Tweet Not Found",
  "status": 404,
  "detail": "Tweet with ID '00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000' not found",
  "timestamp": "2025-01-27T15:30:00Z"
}

request.description: Retrieves a paginated list of tweets for a specific user. Tweets are sorted by creation date in descending order (newest first). Deleted tweets (soft delete) are excluded from the results. Supports pagination with page, size, and sort parameters. Default pagination: page=0, size=20, sort=createdAt,DESC.

response.name: user tweets retrieved
empty tweets list
invalid uuid format error
response.body:
{
  "type": "https://example.com/errors/validation-error",
  "title": "Validation Error",
  "status": 400,
  "detail": "Invalid UUID format for userId parameter",
  "timestamp": "2025-01-27T15:30:00Z"
}

response.name: page size exceeds max error
response.body:
{
  "type": "https://example.com/errors/validation-error",
  "title": "Validation Error",
  "status": 400,
  "detail": "Page size must not be greater than 100",
  "timestamp": "2025-01-27T15:30:00Z"
}

request.description: Retrieves a paginated timeline (news feed) of tweets for a specific user. The timeline includes tweets from all users that the specified user is following. Tweets are sorted by creation date in descending order (newest first). Deleted tweets (soft delete) are excluded from the results. Supports pagination with page, size, and sort parameters. If the user has no following relationships, an empty page is returned (not an error). Integration with follower-api is used to retrieve the list of followed users. Default pagination: page=0, size=20, sort=createdAt,DESC.

response.name: timeline with tweets
empty timeline - no following
empty timeline - no tweets

request.description: Updates an existing tweet with new content. Only the tweet author can update their tweet. The method performs validation on the request data, checks tweet existence, verifies authorization, and updates the tweet content. The tweet content must be between 1 and 280 characters and cannot be empty or only whitespace.

request.description: Deletes a tweet by performing soft delete. Only the tweet author can delete their tweet. The method performs validation on the request data, checks tweet existence, verifies authorization, and performs soft delete by setting isDeleted flag and deletedAt timestamp. The tweet data is preserved in the database for analytics and recovery purposes.

request.description: Likes a tweet by creating a like record. It performs validation on the request data, checks if the tweet exists and is not deleted, verifies that the user exists, prevents self-likes (users cannot like their own tweets), and ensures uniqueness (a user can only like a tweet once). The like operation is atomic and updates the tweet's likes count.

request.description: Removes a like from a tweet by deleting the like record. It performs validation on the request data, checks if the tweet exists and is not deleted, verifies that the user exists, and ensures that the like exists before removal. The unlike operation is atomic and updates the tweet's likes count by decrementing it.

Supports pagination with page, size, and sort parameters. If the tweet has no likes, an empty page is returned (not an error). Default pagination: page=0, size=20, sort=createdAt,DESC.

request.description: Retweets a tweet by creating a retweet record. It performs validation on the request data, checks if the tweet exists and is not deleted, verifies that the user exists, prevents self-retweets (users cannot retweet their own tweets), ensures uniqueness (a user can only retweet a tweet once), and validates the optional comment (if provided, must be between 1 and 280 characters and cannot be an empty string). The retweet operation is atomic and updates the tweet's retweets count.

request.description: Removes a retweet from a tweet by deleting the retweet record. It performs validation on the request data, checks if the tweet exists and is not deleted, verifies that the user exists, and ensures that the retweet exists before removal. The retweet removal operation is atomic and updates the tweet's retweets count by decrementing it.
